data.title: windows server 2003 r2 support
data.meta_description: Hi we have an old windows 2003 r2 server. It has 9498 version installed on it. This version was working till yesterday but we cannot connect to the
data.text:
Hi we have an old windows 2003 r2 server. It has 9498 version installed on it. This version was working till yesterday but we cannot connect to the servers anymore. The newer versions do not install on these machines. what can we do to get logmein to work on these machines?

yes we know the pc's are old.

Thank you. I believe this is happening because we no longer allow connections using TLS 1.0 and 1.1 as they are no longer considered secure.

If you have Internet Explorer 11 installed on these servers you should be able to open its Settings and enable TLS 1.2

After consulting with Support, TLS 1.2 (or 1.3) may not be possible on Server 2003, an upgrade to Windows Server 2008 R2 may be required.

Glenn is a member of the GoTo Community Care Team.

Was your question answered? Please mark it as an Accepted Solution.

Was a post helpful or informative? Give it a Kudo!.

Do you want a new feature added? Make sure you Kudo (vote) for the Idea

Free user and admin training

This is disappointing. Can't we have an old version that we can use?

Our Windows 2003 R2 server is old software but is a VM as its only use is a basic FTP service and running some old legacy automated command line-based tasks. It is not worth the upgrade to Server 2008 with its more limited functions and tighter security on this particular partition.

We only need to access this remotely on a few occasions per year.

Put the onus on the end user and allow them to install potentially insecure software.

My GoTo subscription has become useless. It looks like it's back to VMWARE via VPN
